page.title: 09SALLINS FARM-PICKLESCOTT
page.content: One of the nicest farms our school visited whilst staying at{Lower {Darnford}farm house was{Sallins Farm}, {Picklescott.} It was owned by Mr and Mrs Morris and had an area of 156 acres.It is one of the highest farms in Shropshire,at 1150 feet. The farm is fairly typical of most farms in the area,catering for mainly dairy and 72 beef cattle.What made the farm different from the others that we visited was that it had a{computer } which kept records of how much milk each cow produced,when they calved, when they were ill and how much food the cows ate each day.
